F1,E4.Description: The oven could not execute the function. There may a problem with the Appliance Control Board, or the associated wiring.
StepsToRepair: Power unit down by turning off the circuit breaker(s) for one (1) minute.
Power unit up by turning on the circuit breaker(s).
Monitor the microwave for one (1) minute to ensure the error code does not display again.
Verify microwave operation.
If the problem persists, call 866-333-4591 for Service

F2,E1.Description: There may be a problem with the User Interface / Keypad or the associated wiring.
StepsToRepair: Power unit down by turning off the circuit breaker(s) for one (1) minute.
Power unit up by turning on the circuit breaker(s).
Monitor the microwave for one (1) minute to ensure the error code does not display again.
Verify microwave operation.
If the problem persists, call 866-333-4591 for Service

F4,E0.Description: There may be a problem with the microwave inverter, or the associated wiring.
StepsToRepair: Power unit down by turning off the circuit breaker(s) for one (1) minute.
Power unit up by turning on the circuit breaker(s).
Monitor the microwave for one (1) minute to ensure the error code does not display again.
Verify microwave operation.
If the problem persists, call 866-333-4591 for Service

F4,E1.Description: There may be a problem with the Cavity Temperature Thermistor or the associated wiring.
StepsToRepair: Power unit down by turning off the circuit breaker(s) for one (1) minute.
Power unit up by turning on the circuit breaker(s).
Monitor the microwave for one (1) minute to ensure the error code does not display again.
Verify microwave operation.
If the problem persists, call 866-333-4591 for Service

F4,E4.Description: There may be a problem with the Humidity Thermistor or the associated wiring.
StepsToRepair: Power unit down by turning off the circuit breaker(s) for one (1) minute.
Power unit up by turning on the circuit breaker(s).
Monitor the microwave for one (1) minute to ensure the error code does not display again.
Verify microwave operation.
If the problem persists, call 866-333-4591 for Service

F4,E9.Description: The oven could not execute the function. There may a problem with the AccuPop Sensor, or the associated wiring.
StepsToRepair: Power unit down by turning off the circuit breaker(s) for one (1) minute.
Power unit up by turning on the circuit breaker(s).
Monitor the microwave for one (1) minute to ensure the error code does not display again.
Verify microwave operation.
If the problem persists, call 866-333-4591 for Service

F6,E0.Description: The oven could not execute the function. There may a problem with the Appliance Control Board, or the associated wiring.
StepsToRepair: Power unit down by turning off the circuit breaker(s) for one (1) minute.
Power unit up by turning on the circuit breaker(s).
Monitor the microwave for one (1) minute to ensure the error code does not display again.
Verify microwave operation.

F8,E5.Description: The oven could not execute the function. There may a problem with the Appliance Control Board, or the associated wiring.
StepsToRepair: Power unit down by turning off the circuit breaker(s) for one (1) minute.
Power unit up by turning on the circuit breaker(s).
Monitor the microwave for one (1) minute to ensure the error code does not display again.

FC,E1.Description: Wifi module did not connect to the wireless router. Possible causes include failure to connect due to time out, poor signal strength, defective wifi module or defective router.

NestSettings.AwayOvenWarning.Name: Off While Away
NestSettings.AwayOvenWarning.Description: Receive a notification asking if you’d like to turn your oven off if Nest™ detects you're away while your oven is running.   Please note that it may take up to two hours for Nest™ to send the away signal.

OvenOnWhileAway.Name: Oven On While Away
OvenOnWhileAway.Description: Your home is in Away/Auto-Away mode and your oven is still on

ControlStatus.Name: Control Lock
ControlStatus.Description: Remotely disable the control panel to avoid unintended use no matter where you are.

RemoteStatus.Name: Remote Control
RemoteStatus.Description: Allows you to send remote control of your oven to your smartphone or mobile device via the Whirlpool® app. Lets you manage when to run.  Appliance will not start unless remote control is enabled on the oven.

BrickBakingStone.Name: Brick Baking Stone
BrickBakingStone.Description: Use the Brick Baking Stone to get restaurant style crispy pizza crusts. Can also be used for breads, bagels, rolls, cookies, pastries, and much more. The Baking Stone can be used in both regular and convection ovens. Instructions and recipes are included.

PremiumBroilPanRoastingRack.Name: Premium Broil Pan & Roasting Rack
PremiumBroilPanRoastingRack.Description: It's easy to broil and roast foods when you have the proper tools. The three-piece set includes a roasting rack, broiler grid, and broil pan. The rack holds food above the grid and allows air to circulate completely around all surfaces. The broiler pan and grid are designed to drain juices and help prevent spatter and smoke. It is an easy to clean gray porcelain pan.

SmartTip.Title: Need to get dinner started while you're away from the kitchen?
SmartTip.Content: With remote start enabled, use your smart phone or tablet to preheat the oven and set the cook time from anywhere so the oven's ready when you are.

SmartTip.Title: Can't always hear the oven timer?
SmartTip.Content: Get push notifications on your smart phone or tablet telling you that dinner's ready when you enable Cook Notification on the app.

SmartTip.Title: Preparing to entertain guests?
SmartTip.Content: With remote start enabled, use your smart phone or tablet to turn on Party Mode from anywhere. This setting keeps your dishes warm and ready to serve when you are.

SmartTip.Title: Need an easy way to check if your meat, chicken or casserole is done?
SmartTip.Content: Insert the digital thermometer into your dish before putting it into the oven. After putting it in, connect the thermometer to the jack for an accurate reading of the internal temperature of the dish.

Party.Name: Party Mode
Party.Description: Party Mode is designed to perform function that helps service high volume consumption. Party Mode will keep the oven warning and the freezer producing more ice,perfect for hosting a party.

Quiet.Name: Quiet Mode
Quiet.Description: Quiet Mode Minimizes the appliances operating noise and mutes alert sounds.

Control.Name: Control Lock
Control.Description: Control Lock status of the control panel to prevent unintended use of the participating appliances.

Vacation.Name: Vacation Mode
Vacation.Description: Vacation Mode monitors use of your appliances while you're away.

KeyDance.KitchenTimer: Please set kitchen timer on your appliance to 1 minute and press start.
KeyDance.LightOn: Please  turn ON the oven light on your oven until you see the Congratulations screen on your mobile app.
KeyDance.DoorOpen: Please open your oven door until you see the Congratulations screen on your mobile app.
